docs.text: What and why The objective is to set up a IPv6-only "corporate intranet" type VPN, with services such as secure DNS and NAT64. IPv6 because I've seen various disasters relating to IPv4 corporate networks operating in the 10.x.x.x and 192.168.x.x spaces. Network space Private IPv6 space, RFC-4193. Full network https://www.ultratools.com/tools/rangeGenerator Prefix/L: fd Global ID: 8d407bd075 Subnet ID: 8a7e Combine/CID: fd8d:407b:d075:8a7e::/64 IPv6 addresses: fd8d:407b:d075:8a7e::/64:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX Start Range: fd8d:407b:d075:8a7e:0:0:0:0 End Range: fd8d:407b:d075:8a7e:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff No. of hosts: 18446744073709551616 Local development Vagrant , Virtualbox , Ansible . Vagrant and Virtualbox manage local VMs, Ansible provisions them. Boxes: ubuntu/focal64 gusztavvargadr/windows-10 VPN tools WireGuard , ShadowSocks , TAYGA . WireGuard connects VPN clients and VPN servers. ShadowSocks provides a TCP 443 connection for WireGuard. TAYGA provides NAT64 services for connections from the VPN to the outside world.
